result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Espino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No alcohol.

Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine or any body armor.
May not live where afirearm is kept.

Defense motions the Court for expungement. For the reasons placed on the record, the Court granted the defense request for expungment upon successful completion of probation.
Curfew from 10:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m. for the first 12 months of probation with the only exception being for verified work hours.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing at least one time per m nth.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Espino

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Third Motion to Enlarge Time for Filing Notice of Appeal or Motion for Postconvcition Relief by Attorney Dennis Schertz.

Defendant failed to appear, Court orders defendant committed to House Of Correction for condition time. Court imposed 120 days of condition time at the House of Correction, without good time credit, release to the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments, and for Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Court amends conditions of release to EXCLUDE release for work.
Bench warrant issued in an error on 9-18-2015.

Defendant Daniel J Espino not in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for probation review hearing. Defendant failed to appear, Court orders defendant committed to House Of Correction for condition time.
DOC- Probation Review Memo- received and filed. tk

Defendant Daniel J Espino in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center, work, and inmate work assignments; credit for 3 days time served. Court notes a strong objection of electronic monitoring.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time a month.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
-Defendant may not be in any vehicle where a firearm is present. 
- Seek and maintain full time work and/or school. 
- No contact with Ricky H. (DOB 11-27-1994). 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Curfew from 10 p.m. to 6 a.m. for the first 12 months of probation with the only exception being for verified work hours. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Court imposes and stays 120 days of condition time at the House of Correction, without good time credit, release to the Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments, and for Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Condition time to be imposes at the discretion of the Department of Correction. Probation Review Hearing set. 
Probation Review Hearing set for 9-18-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Defense motions the Court for expungement. For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED the Defense request for expungement upon successful completion of probation. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Daniel J Espino in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Court is in trial on another matter. Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case remains calendared on 3/27/2015 at 8:30 a.m. for the Defendant to appear and receive the new court date. Case will be adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 4-16-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Defendant Daniel J Espino in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record for scheduling purposes. Case is adjourned for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 3-27-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel J Espino in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  David Behm for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of "as approximately 12:20 p.m" as to COUNTS 1 and 2 on page (1).  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel J Espino in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney is not available for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
